What are you looking for Advanced Search Home > All Categories > Dining Out > Fast Food > Resolved Question Trisha T Member since: December 03, 2008 Total points: 135 (Level 1) Add Contact Block
Resolved Question Show me another » Is it a good idea to open American fast food restaurants in Disney parks overseas selling the same kind of foo? selling the same kind of food, sorry 2 years ago Report Abuse by Nick Member since: September 02, 2008 Total points: 640 (Level 2) Add Contact Block
Best Answer - Chosen by Voters I had Applebees in the US, Germany, Kuwait, Qatar, and Ireland. I ordered the same thing and it tasted the same in all places. They all seemed to be fairly busy and made reasonable profits. Source(s): Life. 2 years ago Report Abuse 86% 6 Votes 1 person rated this as good
Action Bar: 1 stars - mark this as Interesting! Email Comment ( 0 ) Save Add to My Yahoo! RSS

Other Answers (2) Show: All Answers Oldest to Newest Newest to Oldest Rated Highest to Lowest by smenante... Member since: March 08, 2008 Total points: 1,049 (Level 3) Add Contact Block As a rule, most of the biggest fast-food chains already have restaurant overseas, regardless of Disney.
The food does vary a bit, however, to account for the taste of the different cultures. 2 years ago Report Abuse 14% 1 Vote 2 people rated this as good by JoeTheCh... Member since: March 06, 2010 Total points: 4,940 (Level 4) Add Contact Block shup foo 2 years ago Report Abuse 0% 0 Votes
